section.title: Introduction
section.para: The FlyMine project is building an integrated database of genomic, expression and protein data for Drosophila and Anopheles and making this available to the worldwide research community via web and bioinformatics interfaces.
An initial release of the database is now accessible, accompanied by full documentation. For more information about FlyMine please consult the more detailed introduction.
Start a query using FlyMine. See quick start guide for more details.

section.title: Datasources
section.para:
FlyMine is an application of InterMine, incorporating the following data sources:
Genome Annotation for D. melanogaster and A. gambiae from Ensembl
Orthologues between D. melanogaster and A. gambiae from Ensembl
Orthologues and Paralogues between D. melanogaster and C. elegans from inParanoid
2-hybrid protein-protein interactions for D. melanogaster: Curagen set (Giot et al (2003) Science 302 1727-1736) and Hybrigenics set
2-hybrid protein-protein interactions for C. elegans (Li et al (2004) Science 303 540-543)
RNAi phenotypes for C. elegans from WormBase
The Gene Ontology

section.title: Funding and contact details
section.para: The FlyMine project is based at the Department of Genetics, University of Cambridge and is a collaboration between the Genetics and Biochemistry departments of the University of Cambridge.
